page.title: 11Local History A Norman Motte
page.content: Today we went to a church in Bures.The mount was quite near to the church and it was near to the road. It had a very good view over the land. On the top of it there used to be a wooden fort but that got destroyed and there was nothing there now. The mount would have been hard to attack because they would have had to climb it to fight.Now it is covered with trees,flowers and stinging nettles. There is a legend that Queen Boadicea is buried under the mound. A lady came and showed us some slides of the area.They were aerial views of fields that have got big rings showing in them at the right time of year.The rings show where chieftains were buried under big mounds of earth with ditches round them.
